name: Colin Moriarty

topics.topic_text: CGTransitionTopic
topics.response_text: No, no, put that away. This one's on the house. And now a toast. To James and his cheery cherub. May your future be safe, bright, and boring as hell.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Colin Moriarty, at your service! Welcome to Moriarty's! My saloon, my home, my slice of heaven in this backwoods little burg.

topics.topic_text: What's all this about Galaxy News Radio?
topics.response_text: Galaxy News Radio is some loudmouth radio station located in the ruins of D.C.

topics.topic_text: Sure, anything to get the information.
topics.response_text: Eager, eh? Good... I like that. It's nice to have a doer in this shithole of a town for a change.

topics.topic_text: So, you want me to do your dirty work?
topics.response_text: Who said anything about dirty work? You need some caps, I'm giving you a way to get 'em. It's just business.

topics.topic_text: No way, Moriarty. No favors.
topics.response_text: Fine. Go find Daddy yourself then. I'll be here when you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: MS11FinDeliverLetterTopic
topics.response_text: Here. These letters arrived for you while you were gone. I'm not a fucking post office you know.{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: I need a drink.
topics.response_text: I used to make Gob take care of this, but what do you need?

topics.topic_text: My Dad told me we were born in Vault 101...
topics.response_text: Aaahhhh. I see. You know, I heard about the brainwashin' that goes on down there. From some other fella, escaped, oh... five years back.

topics.topic_text: Oh, I wasn't born in the Vault? That's complete bullshit, and you know it.
topics.response_text: Aaahhhh. I see. You know, I heard about the brainwashin' that goes on down there. From some other fella, escaped, oh... five years back.

topics.topic_text: You're wrong. My Dad never would have lied to me.
topics.response_text: Aaahhhh. I see. You know, I heard about the brainwashin' that goes on down there. From some other fella, escaped, oh... five years back.

topics.topic_text: You're a liar, Moriarty. I know where I grew up.
topics.response_text: Aaahhhh. I see. You know, I heard about the brainwashin' that goes on down there. From some other fella, escaped, oh... five years back.

topics.topic_text: Huh? My father and I were born in Vault 101...
topics.response_text: Is that what your father told you? That you were born in that hole? That HE was born there as well?

topics.topic_text: You're lying. The Vault's been sealed for 200 years!
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha ha ha! God in Heaven, would you listen to yourself? Do you honestly believe that's true? The lies they've put into that head of yours....

topics.topic_text: Tell me what you know! Tell me everything!
topics.response_text: Ah, temper, temper. And your father was so reserved. Take after our mum, do we? God rest her soul.

topics.topic_text: I was kidding! Dad talked about you all time. Now really, where is he? <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Did he? Well, our time together was brief, but... that is the way of it out here. When a bond is forged, little else matters, hmm?

topics.topic_text: Look, I just want to find my Dad. Do you know where he is?
topics.response_text: You seem like a nice kid, so I'm going to be straight with you.

topics.topic_text: Let's cut to the chase. How much for you to tell me where my father is?
topics.response_text: You catch on quick, kid. That's the way of it out here, for sure. You want something, you take it. Or you pay in cold, hard caps. Say... 100.

topics.topic_text: Tell me where he is, Moriarty, or I'll beat it out of you!
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha! Oh, kid... ah... I'll let that one go, chalk it up to youthful arrogance.

topics.topic_text: I don't have 100 caps.
topics.response_text: All right, kid. Let me help you out, you know... for old time's sake.

topics.topic_text: I don't have 100 caps.
topics.response_text: All right kid. Then I guess there's nothing else we have to say to each other. Come back to me when you have the caps, and we'll talk.

topics.topic_text: All right, Moriarty. Here's 100 caps. Now where's my father?
topics.response_text: Excellent! Your dad raised a smart kid. Really no substitute for the love of a father, now is there?

topics.topic_text: No thanks. I'll find out on my own.
topics.response_text: So you've said. And yet you came back once... Somehow I think we'll be having this conversation again. I look forward to it.

topics.topic_text: 100 caps!? Are you nuts? I don't have that kind of money!
topics.response_text: Guilty as charged.

topics.topic_text: 300? What the hell? You said it was 100 caps!
topics.response_text: I did say it was 100 caps. And as I recall, you said no. So now I'm saying it's 300 caps. What will you say this time?

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, but we had a deal for 100 caps.
topics.response_text: Oh, no no no. I offered a deal for 100 caps. You declined. So now I'm offering a new deal for 300 caps.

topics.topic_text: This is ridiculous. Forget it.
topics.response_text: Didn't you say that last time, too? I have a feeling you'll be coming back again.

topics.topic_text: Okay, let's just take a step back. 100 caps was reasonable, wasn't it?
topics.response_text: Well, I suppose it was. All right; because I'm such a softy, I'll honor our original agreement.

topics.topic_text: Fine, 300 caps. Now spill it.
topics.response_text: Nothing like the sound of caps jingling in your pocket is there? Always brightens my day.

topics.topic_text: I don't have 300 caps.
topics.response_text: Well, that's a shame for you, isn't it? You don't have the caps, and I guess I don't have the information. Disappointment all around.{mocking}

topics.topic_text: Fine, here's your 100 caps.
topics.response_text: Now that wasn't so difficult was it?

topics.topic_text: Yeah, yeah. Here, take your 100 caps. I hope you choke on them.
topics.response_text: How can you be so rude when I'm going to provide you with such a useful public service?{Very mocking tone}

topics.topic_text: Forget it. I'll come back.
topics.response_text: I'll be here.

topics.topic_text: Wait a second! I handled Silver for you, and you still want me to pay?
topics.response_text: It's called economics, kid. You got something I want and I got something you want. Nothing's free.

topics.topic_text: I want to buy a drink.
topics.response_text: No problem at all. I'll take care of you until that lazy zombie wakes up to do his job.

topics.topic_text: Look, I need a way to get some caps or I'll never have the money to pay you.
topics.response_text: If you're looking for a handout, you can forget it. But if you're looking for work, there's a favor you could do for me.

topics.topic_text: That's all I needed to know.
topics.response_text: If you say so.

topics.topic_text: What was it you said about my father, again?
topics.response_text: It's like I said, kid. Your dad was here for a bit, but didn't stay long. Said he was going to the Galaxy News Radio station. Southeast, in D.C.{ }

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Megaton?
topics.response_text: Stay the fuck out of my business, don't go where you don't belong, and buy your drinks here. That's all you need to know.{ }

topics.topic_text: What's the word around town?
topics.response_text: I own a saloon, kid. Rumors are part and parcel. So I'll give you this one for free...

topics.topic_text: Know anything about the area outside Megaton?
topics.response_text: The Wasteland? Why the hell would you want to go out there? Listen to me, lass, Megaton has everything you could possibly need. Why go anywhere else?

topics.topic_text: What do you do around here?
topics.response_text: I keep these yokels knee deep in booze and poon. They keep me knee deep in caps. It's a fair trade, if you ask me.

description:
Colin Moriarty is a 50 year-old Caucasian Male.

Colin Moriarty is a 50-year-old human who has lived in Megaton almost his entire life. He inherited his father's saloon and business empire after his father was killed by raiders in 2241. Moriarty presents himself as a sophisticated businessman with a sharp tongue and sharper business acumen. He can often be found behind the bar of his saloon or leaning on the railing outside, smoking and surveying his town with a proprietorial air.

Colin Moriarty's Personality: Colin is a pragmatic and self-assured businessman who operates on a 'just business' philosophy. He values profit above all else and views relationships purely as transactions. He is dismissive of authority figures like Sheriff Lucas Simms, whom he considers merely a facade of order. Moriarty is skeptical of wasteland ideals and dismisses Three Dog's 'Good Fight' as foolishness. He is cynical, calculating, and always looking to benefit himself.

Colin Moriarty's Backstory: According to Herbert Dashwood, Colin Moriarty came to the former United States as a child with his family. His father recognized the potential of the area that would become Megaton and established trade routes that eventually helped secure the settlement as a trading hub in the Capital Wasteland. After his father's death during a raider attack in 2241, Colin inherited the family business, including the saloon that bears his name. Over the decades, he has expanded his influence in Megaton, becoming the town's unofficial power broker despite the presence of Sheriff Lucas Simms. Interestingly, Moriarty's saloon played a small role in the history of the Lone Wanderer, as James and Star Paladin Cross stayed there briefly after the child's birth on their way to Vault 101.
